item

Class Teleport

  • java.lang.Object
    • item.Item
      • item.Teleport

  • public class Teleport
extends Item
    Implements a teleport with a certain destination.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Teleport()
      Zero argument constructor that makes a new Teleport with no destination.

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination(@NotNull
                  Square destination)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the destination of this Teleport to the given destination if that is a valid one.
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given destination is not valid. | !isValidDestination(destination) || !canHaveAsDestination(destination)

      • canHaveAsDestination

        public boolean canHaveAsDestination(@NotNull
                           Square destination)
        Checks whether the given destination is a valid destination for this Teleport. First the destination must not be null, secondly the inventory of the destination must hold a teleport. The destination square may not hold the teleport itself as a teleport.
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the destination is not this teleport. And if the given destination is not null.

      • isValidDestination

        public static boolean isValidDestination(@Nullable
                         Square destination)
        Checks whether the given teleport is a valid destination for all Teleports.
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the destination is not null.

      • canTeleport

        public boolean canTeleport()
        Check whether this teleport can be used
        Returns:
        True if and only if thos teleport's location is set and not obstructed.
